description: Buy the Fjallraven Abisko Lite Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Abisko Lite Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Abisko Lite Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these shorts because they have become my favorite hiking shorts.  They fit snugly in the waist, but loose in the seat and legs.  The pockets are the right number and in the right places.  They don't show wear at all.
review.name: My Favorite Shorts

review.reviewBody: Best travel shorts that I have bought. Not too tight!
review.name: Awesome Shorts

review.reviewBody:
I bought these shorts in a larger size but exchanged them for a smaller size -- that was the best thing I've done!  They fit great and I
I love the material -- very durable and comfortable.
review.name: Awesome shorts!

review.reviewBody:
Out of winter i prefer hiking in shorts. For this reason I have several pairs from well established brands.

The Fjällräven Abisko Lite Shorts are head and shoulders above every pair I own. Totally reliable, supremely comfortable and exceedingly well designed.

I have loads of Fjällräven kit including trousers, t shirts, shirts, jumpers, jackets, bags and other accessories. Not one piece of Fjällräven kit has ever let me down. Whether trekking across Dartmoor, walking the South West Coast Path or hiking Vatnajökull in Iceland, Fjällräven is my outdoor kit of choice.
review.name: The best shorts I own.

review.reviewBody: I've tried them all and this is the most comfortable for me due to the material and gussetted crotch.
review.name: Still the most comfortable Fjallraven short.

review.reviewBody: I have these shorts and my swimsuit, and that is it. Pretty straight-forward shorts that look great and feel great!
review.name: Maximum comfort!

review.reviewBody: After wearing these shorts for a short period of time, they quickly became my husbands number 1 pair of shorts. When asked what he likes most about them he pointed out that they are incredibly stretchy and flexible but have a nice sturdy feel to them.  He prefers a trimmer fit to his shorts with longer inseams and these were perfect!  They also have cargo short style storage while still looking much cleaner and sleeker.  He does wish there was a second pocket on the rear.
review.name: My husband's go to shorts

review.reviewBody:
Wear these shorts all summer long and never be disappointed. Stretch material is so comfortable you barely notice these are even on. I roll these up and bring them in pack every trip, they're great for when I get to camp and start to chill, they work as swim shorts and dry quick, they work if it's really a hot day and the trail isn't too rugged. 

Only thing is the pockets can be uncomfortable if they're loaded up too much. I rarely use them.
review.name: Mad comfy, can swim in

name: Abisko Lite Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: I love the Sense Aero 5 shorts, so I thought I'd give these a try too. I'm a large in the Sense Aero 5s with plenty of room to spare, but the large in these shorts fits more like a small in the legs. There's absolutely no way I could even climb stairs in these, let alone go for a run. I returned them immediately.
review.name: Way too small

review.reviewBody: I love this short. Fits perfectly. I love the material. I bought another one.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I didn’t realize these were a slim cut, so they are on the snugger side. That said I do like them and they fit well. I love the material.
review.name: Slim cut but nice

review.reviewBody: I don’t love the inner liner. I’m 5’6 and wear size 12/14 jeans and the shorts looked huge when I unpacked them but the liner is tight and uncomfortable. I ordered XL and I guess in Salomon short sizes I’m larger than that? I’ll try them on again when I’ve lost 10 lbs.
review.name: Lose the liner

review.reviewBody: Great shorts, very comfy and very durable. I am excited to use them for many runs to come
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: I really love these shorts and I’m glad I bought them! They fit very true to size. I’m muscular, 5’8” and 190 lbs and ordered a XL. A little room in my waist, but fit just perfectly in my butt and legs. The material feels nice on my skin and has a great stretch for lots of movement. The inner lining fits right. Definitely recommend!
review.name: Love these shorts!

review.reviewBody: I had to send back both small and extra small because they were way to large. Nice short if it fits.
review.name: Runs Big

review.reviewBody: I pruchased this a month ago, they are perfect for running. Long enough to prevent chafing, nice fitting without being baggy or too tight. Super lightweight and comfy, love them!

review.reviewBody: This is a compact bag that gets up and out of the way under the saddle. The attachment is with a strap and BOA that secures it to the saddle rails.  This is not a huge bag but you can get a good bit of stuff in there, and end up with a small package.
review.name: Great Bag

review.reviewBody: For 15 years I’ve ridden road bikes and recently switched over to gravel. My previous saddle bags would get tight on the saddle but over time the elastic would stretch or velcro would separate, not with this one. It stays firmly attached to my saddle and the storage is large enough to carry my items but it’s not bulky. Best of all it doesn’t rattle either.
review.name: Best saddle bag I’ve owned

review.reviewBody: Liked this more than the roll form silica. I could actually get it pretty tight so it does not rattle around. I use tublito or latex tubes so if I really had to I could get about 3 in there. I also put small multi tool, tire lever, a stans dart and a co2 in there no problem. The zipper had not broken yet after about 4 months of use, but it does not feel the best.
review.name: Looks good.

name: Mattone Seat Pack

While cotton base it is very soft compared to some itch of Canada shirt. I got medium and it’s definitely looser fit than medium of Canada shirt FYC. *if you want it fitted I would size down. 
I got wood brown and it is lovely. Hides dog hair and I found it quite cozy under the FJ anorak. And it has pockets ! Of course I have not washed it yet but as all FJ product I anticipate flawless. 🤌✨
review.name: Pockets, loose and soft! Wood brown😍

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality!  Even the inside seams have binding oversewn on them — that’s well made!  There are both side pockets for comfortably placing hands, and the breast pockets are roomy enough to easily slip in a big iPhone. Thick fabric blocks chill and looks great over a sweater or sweatshirt.  It does run big — definitely size down 1 size!  I got mine at a competitors sale but had to share how great these are!  I got two because so awesome - the green one and the rust one, which is a fantastic rich fall color.
review.name: Awesome shacket!

review.reviewBody:
Please bring these back!!! These are amazing hiking shorts with super functional and spacious pockets! They also dry super quickly! I have used these for a few months now and really wish they’d restock the mediums. 

I do agree they run one size larger… I am normally a large but like the medium.
review.name: BEST Hiking shorts!!

review.reviewBody:
Bought these in the tan color and sized down one size based on previous reviews.  Sizing down was the right move and I really like the rise, fit, and coverage the shorts offer. Medium weight stretchy material moves with you but not off of you — also great. 
Tragic flaw discovered the first time I wore them on the trail. Front zipper pockets are constructed so that the teeth of the zipper run out about 1/2” before the top of the pocket and there isn’t a stopper to prevent the zipper slider from going over the end of the teeth and getting super stuck on the zipper tape. Which I discovered midway into a full day hike when I zipped my phone into the pocket and then couldn’t get it the slider back down to open the pocket. The only solution that worked to get my phone out and to allow me to move comfortably again was to pull the slider further up and fully off the zipper tape and teeth. Really loved them up til this point.
review.name: Mostly Great

review.reviewBody: I have wide hips and thicker thighs and have such a hard time finding shorts that fit. Especially athletic shorts. These are looser around my thighs and don’t ride up when I walk. They’re light and breathable. They might fit a little on the larger side having the adjustable waist fixes that problem so I wouldn’t recommend sizing down. Very happy!
review.name: Finally found shorts that fit!

review.reviewBody: I have these shorts in this inseam as well as the shorter inseam and even the pant version. So needless to say I love them! This style does run quite large I would say. I have a small in all styles and both of the other fit great but these ones are a bit big. I am typically a 27 waist for reference - so I go between a small and medium. But I have debated on ordering these in an xs.
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: I was a little hesitant on the sizing but I’m glad I went with the medium. Im usually in between a medium/large(8-10). They fit just right on the waist, not too tight or loose. For reference, my waist measures 33-33.5 in. I have big thighs and these don’t roll up since they’re a bit longer in the middle. No chaffing in these. I got them in both colors! You won’t regret buying them. Can’t wait to wear them out on a hike.
review.name: Great Fit!

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts! I bought them on a whim last summer and immediately went back and purchased another pair after trying them on. They’re flattering, comfortable, quick drying and breathable! I was so happy to see that they returned again this year in more colors. Please don’t ever discontinue the Wasatch Ripstop 5in shorts. I went with my size according to the size chart and to me they fit perfectly. I could probably size down but for this style and look I prefer them to be a on the looser side.
review.name: Perfection

review.reviewBody: Just received these and wore them for a 2.5 mile walk with zero thigh rub and zero shorts creeping up. The high waist is super comfortable. The curved leg shape is flattering and cute, roomy without being baggy. Basically, most of the benefits of mens shorts but look and feel feminine. If you're between sizes, get the smaller of the two sizes you wear. The side pockets are a little shallow (they would stick out the bottom of the shorts if they were much deeper) but have zippers to prevent your things from falling out. 10/10!
review.name: They prevent thigh rub and look cute!

review.reviewBody: I love my new Ripstop 5" Shorts in black and gold.  I'm a curvy5'-3" size 8 and the small fits me perfectly.  I love the built in belt and zip closed pockets--and they are feather light. I've been wearing them around town and am looking forward to hitting the trails with them soon!
review.name: Perfect Fit for City or Hike

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love them but the sizing is way off and for over $50 I would hope the material would feel like great quality but the hiking shorts I got off Amazon for way cheaper feel more durable than these. The worst part is to return I have to pay.
review.name: Sizing is off and material feels cheap

review.reviewBody: I’ve bought three pairs of these shorts. They are great for running cause you can anchor a water belt to the clasp so it doesn’t move. The pockets zip up and I’ve used these shorts for races with no problems.  One coworker stated she really liked the shorts, so that anchors that. They fit fine for men. They’re unisex in my opinion.
review.name: Look great and feel great

name: Wasatch Ripstop 5in Short - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeline Snowboard x Stennerson Pro - LE - 2025
review.reviewBody:
Been riding for 36 years, mostly in New England.  This doesn't make me badass or hardcore, (I'll let people who ride wicked mo-bettah than me make that claim), it just makes me appreciate boards that will allow my old buttocks to have a rad day regardless of the "variable" conditions we see a lot of here on the right coast.
From "edgeable" conditons, to groomers, to the occasional powder day, to big mountain turns in winter and spring (Tuckerman ravine is still a thing, as is the occasional trip to big mountains), this board will get it done in good form.  Snappy, fun, fast, and bomber, it's my go-to whip.  

Jeff
review.name: Death-cookie monster/Ice Coast GOAT

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeline Snowboard x Stennerson Pro - LE - 2025
review.reviewBody: This board crushes in all conditions with speed and control. Camber dominant profile gives me confidence on steeps and high speed groomers. Stiffer than my other Ridgeline it rallies through all conditions, and the carbon stringers give it tons of pop for side hits and drops. Highly recommend!!
review.name: All Mountain crusher!

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeline Snowboard x Stennerson Pro - LE - 2025
review.reviewBody: The Ridgeline is a hard charging all mountain board. This is my go to board for most days at the resort. It handles all conditions well but excels at going fast and locking in deep carves on steeps! One of my favorite things about the board is it  will blast through chunder and does not chatter!
review.name: Big Mountain Board

name: Ridgeline Snowboard x Stennerson Pro - LE - 2025

review.itemreviewed: X-Alp Launch Mid WRX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ride clipless pedals; I don't ride with this shoes, so I bought it as my everyday shoes. It is not comfortable, as Keith mentioned, it rubbed the back of your foot and up (around tendons). I found that this feeling might go away if I tight both straps in a loose way. This is not the main issue that made me walk uncomfortable, it is the areas around your joints. I used to have the crankbrother flat pedal shoes, and that shoes was way more comfortable than this unfortunately...
review.name: Kinda bad for daily wear...
comment: It?s a flat pedal mtb shoe. If you want an every day shoe why buy an mtb shoe

review.itemreviewed: X-Alp Launch Mid WRX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was excited to try a brand other then 5Ten on my flats.  These looked cool and I like the way they tension vs laces.  I put them on and went for a ride and they rub my achilles tendon like crazy.  I literally can't wear them and they sit in the corner.
review.name: They Rub Your Achilles Tendon
comment: What size are they?

name: X-Alp Launch Mid WRX Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Hight MTB BOA Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody: 100% new for 2022. The Hight MTB is the pinnacle of split board boots, with a build designed to last for several seasons. The ELITE liner holds its shape longer than any other Thirtytwo liner ensuring a quality fit while walking around all day long. Removable lateral stiffeners to help with side-hilling icy skin tracks, which also allow customizable flex. It has an all new theory on "Walk Mode" allowing both FORWARD and REARWARD flex for the optimum stride, while the old boot only allowed rearward mobility. This boot has a much lighter weight profile from the original Jones MTB with an all new sole and gaiter design.
review.name: Lighter weight and Built to last

name: Hight MTB BOA Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use it to go running when it's cold outside; alone, it's not enough, but with a t-shirt underneath, it keeps warm up to the freezing point. It's just slightly too big for me, but a cycle in the drying machine made the fit a smidge better. The collar is a little annoying; it's a little too big, but I don't want to open it so the cold can sneak in.
review.name: Overall, pretty great!

review.reviewBody: Love it! Love everything wool. Irish sweaters. Hand knit socks. Love all my Icebreaker clothing. Perfect fit. Tried to shrink after losing weight. Machine washed. Hot dryer. Most wool felts and shrinks with anything other than handwashing. Not this. Wore this half-zip all winter. Seemed like every day for 8 yrs before replacing. Price tag a bit ouchy.
review.name: Comfortable enough to wear every day!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This most recent 260 purchase demonstrates the Icebreaker is making changes for the better. I own several 260's already from past years. This newest shirt has what appears to be a somewhat different weave. It is softer and even more comfortable. It is immediately noticeable and very pleasant. One caveat: I usually wear a size large in Icebreaker, but the Large size here was too big. I exchanged for a medium, which fit precisely. Can't go wrong otherwise.
review.name: Great shirt with a few positive and noticeable changes

review.reviewBody: In short, the wool fabric feels very thin for what's supposed to be a 260 g/m2 item. For a retail price of over $100 it does not feel like I'm getting much actual wool(I got it on sale for half that). I have a cheaper Meriwool 250 g/m2 thermal and it is very noticeably thicker and almost half the price. I confirmed this when holding both items up to the light and the Icebreaker is clearly thinner and lets more light through(see pics) - I was careful to not stretch the fabric and to just let it hang. The Icebreaker however is constructed much better; the stitching quality is clearly superior, and the weave pattern is very consistent compared with the Meriwool. But again, at the end of the day, I'm paying for wool and the Icebreaker just doesn't seem to be made of as much wool. I also posted a pic of the Icebreaker 200 shirt which is one of my favorites and feels just right in terms of fabric weight.
review.name: Doesn't feel like 260 g/m2

review.reviewBody: Caveat emptor: I own two Icebreakers and on both the ink from the label inside the back collar comes off on my skin. I get a black tattoo every time I wear the shirt. I finally put tape over it but of course it comes off eventually. Great quality otherwise but this label problem is a disaster.
review.name: Beware the ink from the label

name: 260 Tech 1/2-Zip Long-Sleeve Top - Men's

So the hardware is solid. The software is ok but could be much better. For $ 600 dollars you should get more

hasVariant.description: Buy the Panaracer GravelKing SK Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Comfort, speed, seem durable. Seems like a great tire. No point trying anything else
review.name: They’re awesome

review.reviewBody: While I have ent road or trail tested them yet. My visual assessment is that they will be well suited for what I throw at them.
review.name: Nice tires, plenty of tread

review.reviewBody: I occasionally ride on very well maintained gravel roads that connect tank firing ranges. The SK is the perfect tire for the transitions between gravel & tarmac here. I've ridden the same area with SS in 35c. I've never had an easy time getting either to seat. Both the SK & SS required fiddling with rimtape, cursing, & several hits from an Airshot. Once the torture of breading them is over,  they hold air for days.  I haven't had a ride stopping puncture with either. This tire is not going to set speed records, but it's quick enough to keep up with B or C groups riders. The tanwall is the perfect shade. Not too yellow or too orange. I'm going to get another set in 43mm for a 3rd wheelset.
review.name: Riding with the King

review.reviewBody: Gravel riding comes in many forms.  This tire is really good if you are sticking to gravel roads and pavement, if you plan on riding in the woods a lot, i would consider something different for added traction.
review.name: Good Gravel Tire

review.reviewBody:
I have to say, for all the hype I'm a bit disappointed. I have these in 43mm on a HED Belgium G Plus rim (25mm internal) and they are very heavy and flick rocks everywhere. I eventually became too annoyed by getting rocks in my shoes, hit in the head with little pebbles etc. The weight feels like a boat anchor. 

Unfortunately, taking them off.
review.name: Decent

review.reviewBody: I put about 50 miles on these tires in mixed use of pavement, dirt trail, rocky and rooting trail, and leaf covered trails with a little bit of mud. So far they give good traction in all conditions. There is some slip in mud, which is not a surprise with the short blocks, but they have pulled me through in all cases.
review.name: Good traction

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these tires.  They seem to be very popular in the gravel community and have a great reputation.  They were easy enough to mount and no trouble running them tubeless on my stock WTB wheels.  My only real complaint is that they pick up and throw tiny pebbles almost like they were designed to do so.  On my first 40 mile ride, I noticed immediately the sounds of little pings off my bike.  I assumed once the brand new stickiness of the tire wore off, this would subside.  After 40 miles through dirt and dust, they're still flinging rocks much more so than any other tire I've used.  I guess I will put a few more miles on them and hope that it calms down.  I get the feeling these are better for dirt and muddy conditions and less ideal for someone like me who tends to ride finely packed gravel on a regular basis.
review.name: Gravel Flings

review.reviewBody:
Just back from DK100 2018 riding the 38s on Stan's wheels tubeless at about 30lbs and these rode perfectly with no flats.  A friend with well know tube gravel tire flatted twice in first 10 miles !  I had solid grip in all conditions including tricky climbs where others spun out.  We had a significant mud section where only those with huge clearance could ride as the mud stuck to everything, these tires included.  But the mud "self cleaned" on gravel downhill.  The tread seemed fine on everything.  Cleaned them up once home and they look brand new.     

6/4/20
Update: Still riding this same pair and they remain great.  No sidewall problems, great balance of traction and speed.
review.name: Solid through the DK100
comment: Glad to hear about the performance of these! Thank you for the feedback!

I also was at DK2018.  Rode the GK 43 mm on my Moots Routt 45. No flat and no issues with the tires.  Held pressure well.  Used Stans race sealant on Zipp 30 course wheels.  No issues in climbs or descents.  I saw plenty of racers with flats on the course.

review.reviewBody:
I like the look of these shoes but they felt far from walking on clouds, very flat.
IMO Hey Dudes are more comfortable & about half the price. Was very disappointed in these. Will stick with New Balance for any sort of cloud experience. I wear an 8 in every shoe and the ON 8's felt too tight for me.
review.name: basic

review.reviewBody: Great pair of shoes that is lightweight and is easy to get on and off especially since it has no laces for you to tie. They are also comfortable and my feet feel well-supported.
review.name: Comfortable and Lightweight

review.reviewBody: Best shoe I've worn. I usually have hip discomfort after walking some. Purchased and wore on a trip to Croatia, walking 15,000 steps each afternoon. Best shoes ever!
review.name: Finally tried them - Love them

review.reviewBody: Heard all the rave and do not recommend. Such a bummer.
review.name: Toes numb

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Cloudaways and Cloud5's to compare fit and comfort for the elusive Hot Girl Walk shoe and the Cloud 5's were the absolute winners. While not as fashion forward as the Cloudaways, the look is still nice and the fit is far superior. They're really easy to get on and off so I look forward to wearing these for air travel and as a versatile travel shoe in addition to my evening HGWs.
review.name: Hot Girl Walk Shoe of the Year

review.reviewBody: Great shoes for hiking and long term travels. Sits comfortably on the feet and most importantly does not rub, completely holds the food.
review.name: Great for hiking

review.reviewBody: This shoe has to be one of my favorite shoes! They are very lightweight, comfortable, breathable, and I walk very naturally in them. My only complaint is that they run small. I am true and true a size 7 and my toe is right at the tip and I seriously considered returning them for half a size bigger but I am hoping they stretch just a little bit the more I wear them. My feet are also fairly narrow and the shoe fits just right. Also, the bottom of the shoes pick up rocks because of the wide spacing, so I can imagine if you live where there are a lot of pebbles, it might get annoying picking rocks out of your shoes all the time. I've worn them for about a week and overall a very good shoe and I think they are slightly better than my Salomons.
review.name: Great shoe overall!

review.reviewBody:
This is my 2nd pair of Foxy Bibs and I wear them in-bounds and out of bounds. I'm 5'9", weigh 145-148 pounds, have longer legs than torso, athletic build and do have hips and a butt. I run cold generally to start and then get overheated quickly if working hard outdoors (skinning in the backcountry), so layering is a skill that I have had to learn and master when doing snow sports.
Pluses: 
-love the fit (not too bulky) and is actually quite attractive (I don't look like Teletubby when just wearing the bib)
-Perfect amount of stretch/ flexibility in the fabric for kneeling, squatting, sitting during transitions in the back country or sitting on a lift 
-Despite having a higher rise over the chest, they are not too warm for skinning and you can take your straps off and let the top portion hang down below your waist if you need supreme venting on warmer backcountry days
-Beacon pocket is kangaroo style and ample room for any size device  
-Additional smaller chest pocket can fit money, ID, CC nicely
-Waterproofed thigh zipper pockets (great for storing ChapStick, snacks, passes)
-Leg length is good for 32-34" inseam - they never feel too short
-accessibility for bathroom use in and outdoors (side zip provides good clearance for undergarments when sitting or squatting)...and yes you have to hold ALL of your pants out of the way to avoid getting anything wet (just like any other bib or garment for females)
-Multiple options for venting at legs (Inner and outer thigh zips)
-Flylow honors customer service issues and requests (repaired my old pair of bibs - seam taping and sent back redone at no cost to me)

Cons:
-Highly flexible outer fabric contributes to breakdown of waterproof material lining inside of pants over time (I have gotten cracks in the waterproof material at the crotch of the pants)
-Seam taping in crotch region comes undone after a few seasons of wear.  Seems that increased moisture in the area causes this to happen, which  (sweating while skinning) is somewhat unavoidable
-Thinner material requires extra layers on cold days (Particularly in bounds) 

Overall impression: After researching several other types of bibs (Each with their own list of pros and cons) I went with the ones that I know and truly do love, so bought a second pair of the same bib.  Reasons for the 4/5 stars:  I would love to say that these are a one bib for all things, but the seam tape issue and thinner fabric leaves me searching for a more heavy duty/ insulated bib or pant for colder days.
review.name: Excellent all around Bib

review.reviewBody: I am new to snow sports and was searching for a good bib for skiing in California (Mammoth). I have used this bib in 40-60 degree temps and with a solid base layer underneath it, wool socks, and jacket I've been perfectly comfortable. Also, with being new to skiing and taking a few tumbles I've never had problems with staying dry. Aesthetically, I liked the slim fit of the pants and at 5'5 115-120lbs the Small is the perfectly length and fit (though it fits more snug around the hips and waist than I expected).
review.name: Fits great, functions well for CA skiing

review.reviewBody:
I’ve owned two pairs of these and used them extensively for multiple seasons while teaching skiing and backcountry skiing in the PNW. I love the fit and style however the waterproofing is not sufficient for heavy use in the PNW wet snow. 

Pros: Athletic fit, very flattering for a more narrow hip body type, which can be hard to find. I’m between a small and a medium usually and size up to a medium in these.  Wonderful weight for layering. Not too hot if worn with light layer in spring touring conditions. Perfect pocket and zipper placement for venting and easy bathroom breaks. 

Cons: side zipper eventually failed on both pairs, though I did get probably 150+ days on each.  Biggest fail is the waterproofing is just not enough for the PNW. The seams leak through within an hour of heavy snow or rain. While this is the case for many shells, there are a few brands that are much more waterproof (Arcteryx and Patagonia) and these do not compare in performance to those in wet conditions.
review.name: Flattering fit but not waterproof

review.reviewBody: I usually wear a large but the Large didn't have much give for movement in the hips and then I got a XL and it was huge on me.  I think if you have a more straight frame and not so curvy (or have a momma lower belly) they would be awesome but alas this is not me.
review.name: Wish I could wear them

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'5", 138lbs,  and typically wear a medium.  I bought a size Medium but had to return it as it was too tight in the hips. I could put them on but they had no give and I wouldn't have had space to move. I'm purchasing a large to see if that will work but am a bit concerned about length.
review.name: Had to return, too small in the hips

review.reviewBody: I am 5'4", 135 lbs, size 36 D chest.  I have been able to wear a women's medium in the past in Flyblow bibs.  These fit tight in my hips and did not fit my chest at all.  Flylow has been on of the companies that I have been able to rely on for fit, they usually seem to have women's curves in mind where a lot of companies tend to make everything for snowboarding man-shaped.  I was disappointed that these were not made more curve-friendly.
review.name: Not made for curves

review.reviewBody: I am a true size 6 and I bought a medium, which is the same size as my previous pair and they are next to impossible to get on. I will be retuning and buying a size large.
review.name: Smaller than previous years

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'5 125 a true 4 athletic but not an athlete. I order medium (please don't forget the size you ordered in the review).  I am typically a small but will size up for layers and comfort.  The medium felt like the perfect size.  It felt more like a size small to me.  it wasn't baggy but could fit layers.  Unfortunately, I needed to exchange so I don't have any details on use.
review.name: Runs small

comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.

We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: This jacket  looks good on paper but when I used this jacket it was not at all waterproof. It was soaked through within minutes. This can be dangerous if you are using this in the shoulder seasons for rain protection.  I even tried retreating with nikwax tx direct wash in waterproofing. It helped a little but it still soaks through in minutes. I cannot rely on this jacket to keep me dry on trail. I hope Marmot can resolve the issue with the fabric not being waterproof as claimed. If this can be addressed this could be a great jacket.
review.name: Doesn't live up to the hype

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I keep this jacket permanently in my MTB bag, and bring it on every outdoor excursion I got on. I never notice the weight, but wow has it saved my butt when unexpected elements come in. Whether it's rain, snow, or a chilling, powerful wind, it's the best thing I keep in my bag for any of it.
review.name: Ultimate Alpine Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A ultra lightweight (I believe it's the lightest jacket Marmot ever sold) packable waterproof jacket that should be in your everyday carry (EDC), especially on rainy days, perfectly fit in your purse/backpack. Only downside is no XS size.

hasVariant.name: Hot Wax
hasVariant.description: Buy the MountainFLOW Hot Wax online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: If you are looking for a bad time, try scraping this stuff off your skis. I would rather scrape the gum off the underside of a table at Denny's. This wax is sticky and gummy, and it is a real pain to get it off your scraper.  It took me half an hour to scrape one pair of skis. I like the idea of a planet friendly wax, but this is not good and I'm surprised they went to market with this stuff without figuring out the application process. Back to Swix and other waxes.
review.name: No

review.reviewBody: This ski wax was disappointing. Trying to scrape this off of your gear will leave you with a headache. It?s a gooey gummy cement-like coating. Performance underwhelmed too. Just not worth the hassle
review.name: Underwhelming

review.reviewBody: This wax seems to work just as good as other stuff  I have used. I am also not a wax nerd so I am not super picky! Had a super warm day where buddies had their dry bases getting ice and snow frozen to it and I had noticeably less crap snow sticking. A sharp scraper helps alot too!
review.name: Just as good and NOT TOXIC

review.reviewBody: Stoked on what Mountainflow's doing and it works! I was a bit apprehensive when I first heard about it but this stuff rips AND you can feel good about it. Made sure I had a sharp scraper and was pushing some sweet ribbons. It seems like using too much wax would make it on the harder side to scrape but overall I'm stoked!
review.name: Phsyched!

review.reviewBody: I?ve used a number of different waxes over the past few years. We have 5 boards that I wax every two days out. This wax was very difficult to work with. It melts weird then clumps when you try to scrape it. You think you?re getting it off then you end up pushing a clump back onto the board. There were sections I couldn?t even get off. I have 5 scrapers currently. They didn?t do it. The base was sticky on the parts I could remove. Ended up getting one of my trusty normal waxes and doing a hot wax scrape to get this junk off. I like the idea but in practice it?s a huge bummer. Stick with whatever other wax you like. This brand needs a bit more work.
review.name: Don?t do it

name: Hot Wax

review.reviewBody: Works as a great base layer over a top too
review.name: Solid layer

review.reviewBody: I love this pullover the fabric is lightweight and comfortable. I use it for running and often layer the Astroman tank under it. Great for Spring and early Fall. Living in the South it is the perfect weight.
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: Next to loving to backpack I love gear that works for me in the field.  I love everything about this hoodie BUT the zipper on the hip!! It caused a sore there under the hip belt. So my question is does OR make a 30 UPF hoodie that does not have it?
review.name: Hate the hip zipper!

review.reviewBody:
This is my new favorite base layer. I’ve worn it on several 90+ degree days and it breathes well, wicks sweat and most importantly kept my skin protected. I like that it zips down in front if wanted to allow for more breathability and the little zip pocket on the side was a nice touch, it fits my chapstick or a couple lifesavers. 

I did take one star away for two issues, and neither of these issues impacts my overall opinion of “new favorite”.

 First, while the fit at the top of the garment is loose and true to size, the hem and the bottom part that goes around your hips is tight with no stretch. I’d say this part runs small and it’s going to be the “limiting” factor on garment sizing- if you’re between sizes like I am (I usually wear a S-M) and you have any kind of hips at all, you’ll want to size up to the larger size, otherwise it will be too tight.  It kind of feels like OR took the men’s fit of the shirt,  put it into women’s colors and pulled it in at the waist, and called it “women’s” without realizing that women also have hips. The sleeves also run long but for that I don’t mind as it’s not egregious, just long enough that it covers the back of my hands/sun protection. It would be nice to see thumb holes added.
review.name: New favorite

review.reviewBody: I purchased this hoodie for sun protection on a recent 9-day backpacking trip. I bought the light grey colour because I thought it could double as bug protection, since the mosquitoes were horrendous. I really liked how feather-light it was, it dried fast and the hood was great when the bugs were fierce. Furthermore, all the bug/blood/sweat stains cleaned up nicely after the trip and it looks good as new! As for durability and wind-proofness, I will bring it on my next two canoe trips this July and report back :)
review.name: Lightweight and effective: highly recommend

description: Buy the Ortlieb Saddle Bag Two online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Saddle Bag Two
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ortlieb Saddle Bag Two online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Roll top w buckles!  Zippers are always getting stuck. Especially just above the rear tire. This works well and feels very robust.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody:
Ortlieb bags have been my go-to bags and I now have 3 of them for my 3 bikes. The great thing is their mounting system where you can put on all 3 bikes and then swap bags for the occasion. I have different size bags and they all serve a purpose.

The only thing you'll want to avoid is getting a larger bag like the 1.6L on a mountain bike with a dropper post. The bag could be too large and hit the rear tire when the post is dropped. I use the smaller 0.5L ones when I take my mountain bike out and it isn't an issue. It can take jumps and very bumpy terrain no problem.
review.name: Favorite bags

review.reviewBody:
It?s well made. Great materials. Pretty light for its capacity. It?s waterproof. It expands or contracts, as necessary. It holds up to a ton of ?stuff!? I like it once it?s on and attached.

It?s mount is a pain; for the life of me I don?t see why they use Phillips head screws over allen for the mount to seat and the adjusting mechanism is frustrating, at best. Have fun sliding it on and getting it the lock to catch before you?ve uttered an expletive. It?s noisy - raise the dead noisy when riding - unless you wrap everything to keep from bouncing and sliding around on the inside.

And, yet, I like it and I?ll keep it. But, I beg you, please don?t make me fuss with that &%$#@ mount ever again!
review.name: War & Peace!

review.reviewBody: Like many cyclists, I have accumulated a ridiculous number of seat bags, searching for The One. This is it, or rather, These Are The Ones. Because these bags can be swapped in and out effortlessly and securely, that means the different sizes can used according to the day, the season and the ride. The biggest one verges on saddle bag size, the small one is for every day. All of them are waterproof thanks to the roll top design, which also means these bags don't rattle since sizing the bag according to the load is quick and easy.
review.name: The best

name: Saddle Bag Two

review.reviewBody: I bought these and the first time out one of them bent. I was really disappointed. I was able to bend it back to mostly straight, but I expect they will bend again and overall my confidence in them is weak. Also, the handle comfort is different from other models that I felt in store. The shape seemed different and didn't feel as natural in my hand. They do get the job done when I need help moving in transition areas and that counts for something. Also reasonably attractive.
review.name: Not what I was hoping for in a number of ways
comment: Thank you for your review. We are sorry your Bliss poles bent during their initial usage. The Bliss poles are one of our recreational models. If you are looking for an exponentially stronger high-performance shaft, a majority of our pole shafts are constructed with heat-treated (HTS) aluminum, providing exceptional durability. The grip on the Bliss is a PAS 2, which should be comfortable but you might find the PAS 1 or Pro G grips found in our high-performance line more comfortable and ergonomic. Hopefully, you can find a LEKI pole that feels good in the hand and provides years of durability and enjoyment. Something like the Elite Lady, Neolite Carbon Women’s or Stella might be more in line with what you are looking for in the future.

name: Bliss Ski Poles - Women's

review.reviewBody: I'm usually a size 7.5 in adidas footwear, I sized up half a size for these and they are very comfortable and tight at the same time, by far the best climbing shoes I've owned.
review.name: Best Climbing Shoes I've owned

review.reviewBody: Have multiple pairs of grandstone's and absolutely love them.
review.name: Best slab shoes

review.reviewBody: Amazing trad shoes ! Comfortable out of the box and the high top protects ankles well.
review.name: Love this shoe

review.reviewBody: Amazing trad climbing shoe with ankle protection and hen jamming around. Please keep them coming
review.name: Best crack shoes ever

review.reviewBody: Thee are by far the best shoe that Adidas/5.10 makes. I really hope they do not make the mistake of discontinuing this shoe like they have so many in the past. DO NOT BOTCH THIS 5.10
review.name: THE PERFECT CLIMBING SHOE. If you have to cut shoes from the brand, cut the NIADs and keep these.

review.reviewBody:
this trad shoe is very well made and super comfortable! it has the style and fit me perfectly as same size as my street shoes, there is no problem to wear it for all day climbing, no matter use it for edging or jamming it work really well.

unfortunately there is a problem, i don't know if its own issue or I use my foot too hard, i ONLY use for 9 trad climbing days, both toe worn out and the left shoe even has a hole in it! i wear for the first 4 days straight climbing, then just once each two month, then another 3 days straight climbing, i use it only on granite rock, all single pitch trad climb. 

It's sad that the rubber can't last longer, no matter how 9 days seem too short, i already sent it for resole to replace 4mm C4 rubber see if it still would be the same lifespan(original come with 3.5mm C4, a bit of thin). If the rubber can be more durable, this definitely would be a perfect shoe!
review.name: everything is perfect except the rubber

review.reviewBody: Seriously great hi top.. been wearing it from Vedauwoo to the Creek to Yosemite on long routes and grinder offwidth pitches and Boulder problems. Super glad to have a hi top that doesn?t just feel like a flat boot: this has an actual techy feel in the toebox, so you can dance across tough faces, too. I fit my street shoe size for performance and up a half size to wear with socks on alpine routes. Stoked to have this in the quiver.
review.name: AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME

review.reviewBody: Comfortable right out of the box and fits well.  Performs excellent on almost all outdoor crags.  I normally use quantum?s and used the same size for these.  These are now my new outdoor shoe for trad and top rope.
review.name: Awesome outdoor shoe.

review.reviewBody: Looooove these shoes. Basically the 5.10 equivalent to TC pros. Ankle support is wonderful. Great trad shoe. Me and my climbing partner have them
review.name: Just lovely!

review.reviewBody: Good, looking forward to a route. Post lockdown. Comfortable
review.name: Comfortable from the box

The material also feels thinner in general and is too stretchy - even the fleece lining is super thin. What a shame. review.reviewBody: I know this helmet saved me from a traumatic brain injury! Last run of the day, it seems that this is always the case.My worst crash ever, even worse than the time I had a double spiral fracture. I fell with a whiplash action on to the back of my head. The helmet saved me! Thank You POC for making such a fine product!!!
review.name: Great helmet!!!

review.reviewBody:
POC helmets are great. I've had a few now over the years. They fit rounder heads (like mine) like a glove. 

That said, I returned this helmet because the box had mildew on the inside and the helmet smelled like mildew. I don't know if it's an issue with Backcountry or POC. I do know that I'm not happy having to dish out $6.95 to ship it back to them because of this defect.
review.name: Great helmet with a caveat

name: Obex BC Mips Helmet

description: Buy the Teravail Rutland 650 Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Rutland 650 Tubeless Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Teravail Rutland 650 Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Rutland 650 Tubeless Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Teravail Rutland 650 Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Rutlands are amazing trail tires. Period. They’re grippy, tough when you need them to be, and flexible enough that you can still feel every bit of the trail. Off-camber and loose corners are where they really distinguish themselves. They feel light and roll fast on pavement to and from the trailhead, and they hold their own in snow. 

I get the reviews that criticize the volume. Initially I thought they seemed skinny for a 47, but I got over the “look” pretty quickly once I felt the ride. 

Highly recommended!
review.name: Love ‘em.

review.reviewBody:
Could be a bit more voluminous. Traction over mud/grassy areas was good. They ride fine on loose gravel as well. On rough, rocky stretches of single/doubletrack I was expecting a bit more "give." But they're plenty durable as I rode lots of hard miles and never had a problem with punctures, etc.
I'd buy again, but I was hoping for more volume in this size range. Next time I'll buy bigger.
review.name: Just fine

review.reviewBody: Lots of traction but not a lot of volume. Get them if you want to stick to dirt like dog hair sticks to fresh ski skins. Dont if you want a wide volume 47c tire. Mounted on a 23mm inside diameter rim they measured narrower than my 43 Gravel King tires on the same rim. Get them if you like complete traction in a corner. Dont if you like to live dangerously and power slide the rear wheel on a pea sized gravel descent.
review.name: Eh.

review.reviewBody: I installed the tires and found the rear tire going low. After airing the rear up 3 times I found 5 holes in the sidewall of the tire. I found more micro bubbles forming in the same fashion that later turned to more holes. I never got to even ride the tires. I won't buy these again. Maybe just poor manufacturing? I don't know.
review.name: Went Flat Before I Even Got On The Bike

name: Rutland 650 Tubeless Tire

review.itemreviewed: BV450 Solo Bear Resistant Food Canister
review.reviewBody: Having a problem in the Adirondack high peaks with bears getting into these cani
review.name: Not bear proo

review.itemreviewed: BV450 Solo Bear Resistant Food Canister
review.reviewBody:
But not quite. Got it for a trip in RMNP last summer, first morning I'm woken up by the black bear getting mad that he couldn't get in, pretty entertaining to watch. 5 minutes or so of trying to convince him to give up, I get it back. He got the right idea but he turned it the wrong way. Second night one though it was a chew toy, good scratches, nothing major. 

My only complaint would be it needs a way to be lashed to a tree, only so I don't have to follow a bear for half a mile to get my food back.

I have the 500 version, easily fit food for 2 for 4 nights, it's huge and heavy, it's a decent chair, your food is safe, you might have to find it but it's safe, did I mention that it's huge and heavy?  Gotta have it some places, not others, but it's worth it anyways.
review.name: He almost got it

name: BV450 Solo Bear Resistant Food Canister

review.reviewBody: I only use bladders from Platypus for years. They are tasteless, weightless and my old ones are still not leaking. For 10years! That’s very impressive and that’s the reason I only go with Platypus.
review.name: Love Platypus!

review.reviewBody: Was a good bottle. But started to leak after a month. Unable to use now.
review.name: Was a good bottle. But

review.reviewBody: I purchased two of these soft flasks for ski touring, as I like staying hydrated but don't like hard bottles in my ski touring pack (added weight and hard if I fall). Previously, I've used other soft flasks and they've never made it a full winter before cracking around the nozzle. A week before Christmas, a friend Kyle Smaine posted a video to youtube speaking to some last minute presents ideas for loved ones who ski tour. I selfishly was hoping that he mentioned ZipFit, the company I work for. He didn't, that's okay. However, this Platy 2.0 L bottle was one of the gifts. I added one to my cart and then added another to my cart, because I knew I wanted one, but figured my ski touring partner Drew might also want one. I've used it every day since it arrived (just before the holidays). I love it. I am hydrated and I have Kyle to thank and this Platy 2.0 to thank. Just over a week ago, Kyle passed away in an avalanche in Japan. Really heavy to process. This bottle reminds me of his joy, his smile, his love for skiing. I'm happy to have it. For this reason and it's functionality.
review.name: If Kyle Smaine Recommended It, It Has to Be Good.

review.reviewBody: Worked great, refilled at camp and carried with all day, no leaks, no bad taste.
review.name: Worked great, refilled at camp

review.reviewBody: The platy 2.0L bottle is great for extra water storage. I always keep one or two in my pack. They weigh almost nothing, they're tough( I fell on mine when it was full and it didn't break) and they take up almost no space. For me it's a no brainer.
review.name: The platy 2.0L bottle is

review.reviewBody: Bought these bottles to replace old dirty ones. I had no issues with the older ones. Great to have while at camp or a very dry water section of the trail.
review.name: Bought these bottles to replace

review.reviewBody: Works great for section hiking the AT. Carried two.
review.name: Works great for section hiking

review.reviewBody: Never expect something that is so light will last as long as a heavier duty collapsible. My experience over 45 years lugging water up and down mountains favors carrying a mix of a couple lw bladders and a sub quart size plastic bottle or two on extended solo trips for low weight, versatility and backup. Having mateable threads between bladders, filters, couplings, and bottle is a good idea. Platypus edges out Sawyer's squeeze bags slightly in durability, and several other companies make more durable, and heavier options. The Hydropak 3 liter is a pretty solid choice for larger capacity storage. I usually gravity filter, and squeeze only if I have to, and have water storage capacity to camp or bivy away from water when required. Avoid creasing plastic bladders near spouts and welded seams... Clean with warm soapy water, rinse, and store completely full to reduce microbe growth. For long term, add a drop or two of good old bleach to the full bag and don't waste time drying!
review.name: Good lightweight water bag for what it is

name: Platy Plus Bottle

review.reviewBody: So I am a runner that likes to ride a couple of times a week which means I'm in fairly good shape and will often go for a 3 hour ride on some rocky terrain or go on an all day ride in the mountains without having ridden a ton.   Everything usually feels good except my under side.  I ask friends and they always just tell me that I need to ride more to get the back side into shape and that has helped some but not nearly as much as switching my saddle.  I feel good the next day after having been on this saddle rather than down right sore
review.name: Game changer for me

review.reviewBody: Comfortable except the 9 is like a 10... I had to add an insole. Love these
review.name: Comfortable and Functional

review.reviewBody: The Bogs designs used to be great for my foot shape, but unfortunately, the design of the last few years consistently do not work. Overall, the show looked nice, but it simply does not fit. Even with varying the thickness of socks - the shoe is either too small or tool loose. SEEKING: I'm trying to replace the 'duck shoe' which is awesome in the garden: easy to clean the mud (vs the very tight treads that are difficult to clean) and yet has good traction and fist my foot (wide at toebox/narrow at heel).
review.name: Recent designs no longer fit my feet / wish they could

review.reviewBody: Love these slip ons for running in and out to the garden. Nice padding too. I've always loved Bogs boots so am happy to have a summer version. Such high quality always!
review.name: Can't go wrong with Bogs!

review.reviewBody: This is my first pair of low cut Bogs and they are just right-slip into easily for quick trips, enough coverage for the yard, comfortable and wide. This beautiful pattern is sweet as well as a shoe that is utilitarian.
review.name: Versatile and stylish

review.reviewBody: With a garden hose, it's easy to rinse them clean, removing all that muck from the yard work. I expect to have these for many years to come.
review.name: Simple and Practical

review.reviewBody: Since I have destroyed many pairs of shoes over the decades, I'm happy to invest in something that will endure several seasons of dirty urban gardening, these fit the bill. Rain, mud or snow - these work great. Wear and rinse off as expected. They are solid, formed rubber clog/shoes and perform well under any rugged conditions.
review.name: Great gardening clogs

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect gardening shoe! There are no holes to let dirt in and easy to put on and take off; a quality I've found in all of my four pairs of Bogs shoes. The comfort is wonderful and is as good as any I have found in expensive shoes and boots. I'm a devotee and have been for years.
review.name: Comfy, easy, functional

review.reviewBody: This style runs at least a full size large. For me who wears a women's 6 I can't size down because the size is 6. What a disappointment!! They were returned.
review.name: Not happy with these shoes

review.reviewBody: The 7 I first received was way too big. I exchanged for a 6 which is still a little big. Socks help, but I was hoping to wear with out socks. I'm keeping them because they still are comfortable and will be good to run outside to feed the birds. Easy on and off!
review.name: Will Work

review.reviewBody: Love the color. Shoe feels wide. Bought a size smaller than normal.
review.name: Colorful but feels wide

hasVariant.description: Buy the Flylow Firebird Bib Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I've tried on and returned two jackets and pants from FL.  Fit is Weird ASF.  Jacket arms and Shoulders are great, but the waist forget it.  I'm a size 30, the jacket was so tight, think sausage casing, because I could barely fit it over my pants.  The FL pants advertised 30-32 on the waist... No Way was this true, felt more like 28.  So, I tried on a size M, waist was perfect!  could even rock my impact shorts, however the length was horrible.  Felt like a clown or teen at the park  Pants bunched up at the bottom. 
 Ugh. The QC on these are horrible. Maybe next year will be better.
review.name: Weird Fit for people who wear Size S

review.reviewBody:
Should have listened to other reviewers! On my 3rd day of resort riding, while sitting down to load a lift, felt the material near the seat of my bibs split. Obviously, a material defect thought nbd,  easy replacement from a local company.

Took my bib in to the FlyLow warehouse. Was informed that this was considered “wear and tear” and “should be expected” after 3 days of typical use. Thankfully, an employee offered to patch the defective material, with a 2 month turnaround. 

Carried my bibs home and followed up with the Warranty Department. Company representative informed me that their material was “susceptible to tears” and that patches “if anything, makes your gear stronger”. Insane company policy that offloads low quality material onto regular users.

Could not recommend this company less! Stick with other gear manufacturers that actually stand behind their products.
review.name: Terrible quality bibs, worse warranty

review.reviewBody: I'll echo the sizing issues, they're odd. Be prepared for a return to the days of JNCOs. But that's not the reason for the 1 star review.  After a single use they were all slit up on the inside at the bottom on both sides, right thru the reinforced fabric. Didn't fall at all, not sure when they even would have contacted the edge of my definitely not freshly sharpened skis. Probably the balloon sizing contributed? I feel bad for those that paid full price. Hopefully I can return them because I wouldn't think normal wear and tear for ski pants would be to rip from skiing once.
review.name: Ripped after one use

review.reviewBody:
Though I'd brave the bad reviews on sizing and now feeling like a fool. I plan on returning before using and going back to my 15 year old costco ski pants which fit better.

These might work for some people, but I wouldn't recommend  because of the elephant legs. You have a nice fitting waist and chest section but the legs are just these giant loose tubes. I don't mind the baggy freestyle look but for me this is just a matter of practicality. The material is so loose that the material rubs a lot and makes a ton of noise and you can really feel that friction. There's basically no leg tapering. So while they are light and you can definitely move around, it feels like I'm wearing a big plastic bag around your thighs and calves. So overly cumbersome for any uphill and not a very athletic feel.  Unless your thighs are thicker than your waist or you plan on wearing three layers of pants under these shell bibs, I can't see this fitting most people.

All that said, material is great, nice pockets, seems like a sturdy and well-made bib. It's a shame that the sizing is so weird. Other flylow I've tried on fit better but I was hoping for something lighter and cheaper with these.
review.name: Leg size is bizarre :/

review.reviewBody: I liked the product for the style, pockets, overall feel.  I am 6 ft and 175lbs.  Traditional build.  This was weirdly snug in the gut without any layering (didn't try with layering).  Everything else fit perfect.  A perfect person for this would be much thinner than average.   I could go up a size but then I assume that all the other areas would be too big.  Too bad because everything else was great
review.name: Nice product - weird sizing

review.reviewBody:
While reading the specs I could not figure out if the bibs were insulated or not. They are not. Great quality, but more like a shell. Probably great for backcountry skiing/ skinning and terrain park but not good for groomed runs and freezing when zitting on lifts. 
Also, probably like most thing you buy; if you are very tall and skinny, XL doesn't not work. XL large are for people that are a bit larger all around. 
But other than that, they look great and seem to be of great quality.
review.name: Not insulated - more like a shell

review.reviewBody:
2022-04-07. Per the size chart, I would fit a medium. 5'7" (168 lbs), 39" chest, 33" waist, and 31" inseam. But in reading some of the reviews, I opted to go with the large due to their comments about the torso area being tight, and the image of the model (the pant legs looks slightly bunched up at the bottom). So I went with the large size that I knew would be too big in the waist (34") and inseam (32").

FYI: The other reviewers are correct, which is why they say the fit is so weird. Per Flylow the measurements in their size chart are to reflect the buyers body measurements. In reading this, I assumed that they would add some room for comfort and layering. Well they sort of did... The legs provided plenty of extra space as some reviewers commented; however, the torso measurements of the garment seem to be pretty much the same as the body, so there is very little to no room for a thicker layer like a sweat top. 

The large is quite roomy for me, and there is space in both the torso and legs. I was able to wear a base layer, a turtle neck, and a sweat top and it fit snug up top... not very comfortable for me, but I'll never wear a sweat top, so I'm ok.  Going up in size made the leg room even larger... probably too much if you do a lot of back country, but ok if you're more a park person.

As far as performance goes, the quality and functionality of the Firebird Bib did not disappoint. Seam sealed, and waterproof as advertised.

Bottom line, the fit is kind of out of proportion as others have commented. You'll be better off looking for something with more consistent fit between torso and legs. But if your heart is set on the Firebird Bib, then understand how you dress and what you'll be using it for before deciding on size. If this will be purely for the slopes and you don't layer up much (i.e. a thermal base layer and a top), then I'd say go true to the size chart. If you like to layer up with more than 3 layers, or if you'll be using this for other winter activities (sledding, or just playing in deep snow), I'd size up to allow the room for extra layering. The only other notable about sizing up is that the gaiters will naturally be larger in circumference, so if you don't have a heavy duty boot (with girth), the gaiters may not perform as intended.

For how I'm going to use these, a medium would have suited me just fine, and would probably have been a better fit. But my true measurements are an inch smaller than the maximum sizes per the size chart. For this reason, I'd say the "fit" of the Firebird Bib run small. If your measurements are at the maximum per the chart, I'd size up.
review.name: True to size... kinda...

review.reviewBody: I did not read the reviews prior to purchase and glad I didn't. Maybe I have a weird shaped body, I don't know. I got a large and they fit true to the size chart. Yes, they are pretty baggy in the legs, but become more tapered as you work your way to the shoulders. I do not mind baggy ski wear though. If you want something more slim probably not the product you want. There are velcro straps on the side to tighten the waist if needed.  They have great pockets and massive vents down the legs. Color was great and I am excited to get these on the hill. The video of the product is the best depiction.
review.name: Great Bib Fit Was Not That Weird

review.reviewBody: NO ROOM AROUND THE MIDSECTION! Length is good, plenty of room for the legs. If you want to wear a sweatshirt underneath your bib, you will have trouble unless you?re a toothpick. Quality of fabric looks good though
review.name: Bad

review.reviewBody: I own the Foxy version in women's and they are flattering and functional......so I bought what seemed like the male equivalent.  The functionality of these pants is the same and awesome, but the fit is very weird and the pant legs seem like park/snowboard worthy.  If you want to ice climb or backcountry ski, the pant legs are too voluminous to fit in gators and are not fitted enough for backcountry skinning.
review.name: fit is weird

name: Firebird Bib Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
With the EASTON EA50 AX Handlebar, You will get better control on the Gravel & the road.
with this Flared Drop bar it allows you a wider grip to lift & throw the front end around, Just like MTN biking & we all know how important having proper control is with rapidly changing Gravel & Road conditions. Unlike a standard Drop bar if you hit a hard bump on the road & your had slips while on the hoods, It can slide wright past the drop out position of the bar.
With the Flared drop position of EA50 AX bar set your had can slide wright into the cradle of the drop out every time Insuring better control & safety on rough terrain & bumps in the road.
Other benefits of this Wider Flared Adventure Series bar, are the ability to throw on a Large front bag & still have clearance for your hands.
If your wanting to up grade that Grave bike or Road this is one of the best UP-GRADE'S you can make for your dollar & you wont be sorry
review.name: GETTING A BETTER GRIP WITH THE EA50 AX

review.reviewBody: Great fit for my narrow face and has to be one of the largest coverage/ best protection from Smith, which is nice for backcountry skiing. That said it the lens may be too tall for some - it is almost too big for my Giro mtb half lid (lid sits on top of lens and tends to push glasses down). Seemingly higher quality lens than other Smith glasses I own (lens seems to have better clarity), however it is heavier relative to the Attack MTB (most of the weight coming from the lens itself). I wouldn't consider them heavy, but enough that I do feel them after several hours of wear relative to the Attack MTB. I haven't messed with changing the lens so I can't comment about that.
review.name: Purchased as Replacement to Attack MTB

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have 6 of these and I absolutely love it he comfort and fit.  I was an only cotton underwear purchaser.  These have totally converted me.  I will never buy anything else.
review.name: Most comfortable perfect fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These briefs have unbelievable superpowers. I only just replaced the first two pairs I purchased a few years ago for a hiking trip.  Most briefs barely last a calendar year before the elastic starts to go and fabric starts to run. Love how easy ExOfficio briefs wash up and how quickly they dry. The new colors are nice and the fit is perfect.
review.name: Briefs with Super Powers!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love how the underwear fit, wash, dry, and the space saved in luggage.  My only issues with them are more odors after a long day, and the newer ones have too long of tags.  Despite that, this is the only kind of underwear my family travels long distances on.
review.name: Long lasting

review.reviewBody: These are great. A bit pricey, the briefs provide comfort and quick-dry convenience.
review.name: Comfort and Convenience

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Breathable, full coverage, doesn’t ride up or move, and washes and dries easily while traveling.
review.name: Best travel underwear ever!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have worn this underwear for years, and they never wear out. Love them for travel, as I can wash them in the sink at night, and they are dry by morning.  They are the best I have found for running, as they don't slip, and keep my tights/shorts from slipping.  Very happy camper here, and customer for life.
review.name: Great All-around Underwear

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this for a trip to South Africa.  Was gone a month.  Washes great!
review.name: Best travel underwear

review.reviewBody: Purchased these as a gift for my wife to keep her hands warm on cold ski days. She has been very happy with these Mitts. She has used them to ski in down to 15 degrees with single digit wind chills.
review.name: Great Ski Mitt!

review.reviewBody: Bought these before a ski trip last month. I have Raynauds and struggle to find mittens that actually keep my hands warm. These were amazing. My hands were perfectly warm the whole time and I didn’t even need to use hand warmers, which is a first. I measured as a size 7 and the width fit comfortably. The length felt a little long for my fingers but I never had any issues with that while skiing. Also loved the wrist bands attached to the gloves. Highly recommend these!
review.name: Love these mittens!

review.reviewBody: I got these for my wife for the ski season. They kept her hands really warm and she liked the wrist leashes. She used to wear two pairs of gloves and no she only needs these. Highly recommend d.
review.name: Great mitten

review.reviewBody: The light grey is almost white.  I love Hestra mittens!  They keep my cold sensitive hands warm especially with the hestra heated mitten liners.  I frostbit my fingers about 20 years ago (driving an old jeep wagoner that did not have great heat when the temps were single digits).  The sizing chart is true to size.  I have an old pair, maybe 15 years old that I wore skiing all the time & wore out the liners (replaced twice), not realizing I had stretch out the leather & they are so big.  The old ones will be used to shovel snow.
review.name: warm!

name: Patrol Gauntlet Mitten - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Mayfly OSMO Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I find the tent very good once it is pitched. But, it is difficult to get the tension correct on the corners that don’t get support from the poles. They always seem to sag in towards the middle. Another big gripe is that the ends of the poles stay in the black plastic inserts when you try to remove them. The poles separate more easily than they come out of the black plastic holders. This really makes taking the tent down difficult.  I really like the tent once it’s pitched, no complaints. Materials are great, ventilation is good, very roomy. But set up and take down could see some improvements.
review.name: Good, but…

review.reviewBody: I have only had a chance to take this out once (in the summer) so I cannot comment on the warmth, but this is a very comfortable pad!  I literally got the best night sleep I have ever had camping. I had to grit my teeth to pay this much for a pad, but glad I did!
review.name: Very comfortable for a side sleeper

review.reviewBody: The fabric is crazy durable yet weighs nothing. It’s a good size for 2 people backpacking and will keep you dry. Stuff bag can double as a bag to hang from a tree. Tent poles and ground stakes feel durable.
review.name: Worth the price

review.reviewBody: This tent offers quite a lot for what you pay. Full of convenience features, nice and roomy and still super light and packable this tent is a perfect addition to your backpacking kit. I really also like that fly is made from OSMO fabrics which are more waterproof and durable than regular silnylon. I noticed a lot less stretch in the tent fly after a rainstorm and felt like the fly didn't soak up nearly as much water either which made packing up in the morning easy. Overall super pleased and can see this tent coming on many more adventures in the future.
review.name: Great value for the price!

name: Mayfly OSMO Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Accessory Carabiner Set - 3-Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Accessory Carabiner Set - 3-Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Accessory Carabiner Set - 3-Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Using these to hang gear off cruisers vest. Working great.
review.name: Work great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good, small, standard carabiners. Exactly what I was looking for.
review.name: Carabiners

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfectly sized carabiners for attaching things to the outside of your pack. The gate mechanism is solid and doesn’t catch on things. It’s hard to find carabiners as quality as this at such a small size, so I’m glad for these.
review.name: Perfect for attaching things to your pack

review.reviewBody:
I got these carabiners as lightweight and small accessory hooks for a 2023 AT thru hike. I very quickly figured out just how useless they are. The simplicity would be unmatched with just a few small design tweaks.

The biggest issue is that the rest point when the wire gate is closed is hook shaped. That means these grab hold of literally anything when you attempt to remove them. That combined with the small size makes it difficult to maneuver and detach them with a single hand under pressure.

Now you might be thinking this is somehow a good thing because the chance of unintended detachment is therefore quite low. Think again. The other issue is that when the gate is opened just enough to pass the hook shaped rest point, it can be very easily misaligned, spring outward, and fall off completely. This happened on trail for me, though thankfully I didn't lose anything.

For future hikes, I've already switched these out for some other carabiners with a smooth angular resting surface and solid gates, rather than the loose fitting wire. While these serve no real purpose, they are at least neat to look at but not worth that price.
review.name: Ultralight but Useless Due to Design Flaw

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great little carabiners! I use them primarily to help strap my camera to me while hiking and backpacking. They are very strong and durable.
review.name: Awesome carabiners!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This replacement buckle was a huge improvement over the flimsy original on my Chaco waist pack. It's much sturdier and was easy to install. The price was reasonable, too.
review.name: Big Improvement

review.name: Strong & small enough !

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

The Kids' Arctic Blast™ Heavyweight Beanie is an absolute game-changer for chilly days! Crafted with exceptional quality, this beanie is a winter essential for keeping little heads warm and cozy. The heavyweight material provides excellent insulation against the cold, while the snug fit ensures it stays in place during all their adventures. Its durable construction means it can withstand rough play and frequent wear. Plus, the vibrant colors and fun design make it a hit with kids of all ages! Whether they're building snow forts or hitting the slopes, this beanie is a must-have accessory for any winter outing. Highly recommend!

review.name: Great look

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] One of the best yakkers that I have for snowboard
review.name: I would get more but I don't have more space in my sweet guy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm, fashionable, dry, many nice features.
review.name: On spot1

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This can be considered a joint review for the Clement Triclimate jacket, the Mountain light Triclimate Gore Tex jacket, the Thermoball Eco Triclimate jacket and the Side Cut Gore Tex jacket, as over the past month I've owned and returned all of them, as I don't believe any of them are remotely worth the prices tnf is charging for them. In virtually every aspect the quality of The North Face has dropped dramatically compared to just eight years ago. The shells on all the jackets were unbelievably thin, not retaining warmth and barely resisting moisture. Many short cuts and compromises are obvious in the construction resulting in a product that feels cheap and flimsy, a far cry from what the company was producing a decade ago. The zippers struggle to catch and it's awkward to work them up the front of the jackets. The overall sizing of each jacket was awkward and inconsistent, all of them trending too small, another hallmark of cheap, uninvolved garment manufacturing. The drawstrings all loosen with the slightest bit of movement, thus exposing the wearer to cold wind. Another thing older tnf products never did. Both the gore Tex and DryVent shells, regardless of the material composition and density are unbelievably thin across all the jackets I tried. And to top it all off, despite producing products that are only 30 to 40 percent the quality of past years, the prices for tnf products are higher than ever. As it stands, I'll never purchase another North Face product, and cannot recommend them to anyone.
review.name: The North Face is Dead

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Went on a four day ski trip in VT with this jacket - I love it! I was warm and dry all four days despite the conditions being wet and 10-15 degrees F. Plenty of pockets. Absolutely satisfied with the purchase.
review.name: Would recommend!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The jacket was opened & the package was ripped open. Besides that, the jacket was a little small & I'm 5'11" and had originally ordered a Medium. So I reordered Large. There were only 2 zippered pockets and I wanted at least 4. The other 2 pockets were Velcro.
review.name: Decent or average

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great jacket, very warm for my Alaskan trip
review.name: Second one great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this coat. The inner matter by itself is a great jacket, and both layers together are darn near perfect. There are pockets for days so I can hide snacks from my kids and they can't possibly find them. I also really like that the good tightens from the back instead of from the collar, it stays in place well and gets tight to my ears to keep them warm. I hope I don't need to buy another coat for quite a long time, but if I do I'd seriously considering another one of these, it has everything I need.
review.name: Snack pockets for days

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got this for my boyfriend for Hanukkah and he is obsessed! He loves the color and that it's basically three jackets in one. He's already worn some form of it to almost everything we've done and we haven't even snowboarded yet!
review.name: 5 stars North Face!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is extremely high quality and very warm. I love it.
review.name: High quality
