review.reviewBody: This product only comes with triple A batteries.  You have to buy a rechargeable battery separately.  That battery also requires a special charger which is ALSO sold separately.  All in cost is almost tripled.
review.name: Not rechargeable

review.reviewBody: Use this for Nordic skiing at night. It’s very bring, and the adjustable light levels allow for the perfect reflection of light in every case.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I bought this headlamp for a last-minute climbing trip since my usual gear was in storage, and I didn't have high expectations given its small size. However, I was pleasantly surprised by its performance. It provides enough light to make me feel safe, and it's both lightweight and comfortable to wear. Paired with the battery pack, the Cosmo offers decent battery life—not the best, but definitely better than I anticipated for the price. I'll definitely be adding this to my pack for future trips.
review.name: The little light that could

review.reviewBody: Timed a 9 hour hike wrong and ended up doing the last two hours in the dark. Was severely underpowered. I’ve used this before for cooking and hanging around camp and its fine, but not up to the job of hiking at night which is why I have it. Bought this to replace my old reVolt and wish they still made that model because it worked much better.
review.name: Let me down when needed

review.reviewBody: The Cosmo is one of the easiest headlamps to operate. Simply press the button for on and off and the other for color and level. Plenty of light and a small package. This is a go to headlamp for 99% of activities.
review.name: Simple and Bright

review.reviewBody: I haven’t used it yet, but I light that it has multi functions so will be versatile for backpacking and upcoming travel to the Dolomites!
review.name: Multi function bright light

review.reviewBody: Easy to use, always reliable, ready to use with batteries. Have one in every pack!
review.name: Always reliable

review.reviewBody: I bought it to run an Ultra trail Mont Blanc serie and reault great. Very lightweight, really comfortable, powerful light!
review.name: Glow Up the trail!

review.reviewBody: Perfect headlamp for sailors who need both red and white light.
review.name: Perfect headlamp for sailors who

review.reviewBody: My old head lamp was beyond old and couldn't recharge anymore so I bought this head lamp as my last one was from Black Diamond. It's amazing! The area it lights is amazing! I love the idea of rechargeable batteries so I'll try to get them soon. Love this head lamp!
review.name: Awesome Cosmo 350 Head Lamp!

name: Cosmo 350 Headlamp

review.reviewBody: I bought these prior to a mountain bike jump clinic.  After an hour I had to take them off due to pain.  Most uncomfortable mt bike shoe ever.  Spend the onet and buy  510s.
review.name: Uncomfortable!!!

review.reviewBody: Purchased and paid with expedite/overnight shipping as I needed it but I never received the item. Went to a wrong address, and both Fedex/backcountry are impossible to reach for any update.
review.name: Never received! Paid extra for expedite
comment:
Hello,
We are very sorry about the shipping issues. We have sent a follow-up email on this. We look forward to hearing from you!

review.reviewBody: The Vibram sole on this shoe will tear up so fast it will blow your mind. The gum on the sole was 100% unusable within 400 miles or regular enduro riding. These were so bad I email Giro and they replaced them no questions asked.
review.name: Sole Will Tear Up So Fast!

review.reviewBody: Was not impressed with these shoes.  Sole was weak and had no support.  Peddles (Raceface Chester) tore up the bottoms.  Feet were sore after 20+ miles of riding with 3000 feet of climbing.  Had peddle slip in damp conditions.  Love the look and they make a great casual sneaker.  Used these to replace my Specialized 2FO and now I'm going back to the 2FO.
review.name: Weak sole  Sore feet  No grip

review.reviewBody: I admit I clicked "order" with my eyes closed. First pair of flats for me and the reviews on these were mixed. I do a lot of hike a bike so I needed a pari of shoes that I could walk comfortably and with a grippy sole for when I hike with the bike on my shoulders. These shoes are just great. Very grippy on pedals (RF Chester) and on any terrain I walked over. They are also comfortable, I had no blisters, not even on the first hike. The toe box is roomy and very protective. They seem well built and should last a few seasons. The only reason for giving 4 star is the inner sole which is very thin and offers no arch support. I am used to change inner sole in all my shoes (high arch) but for someone who isn't these shoes may feel hard and uncomfortable. For the right fit I measured my feet in centimeters. Definitely worth the $!!!
review.name: One more time Giro doesn't disappoint

name: Jacket II Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Gave these to my brother-in-law as a gift; he works outdoors in Holland.  He absolutely loves the pants and frequently comments to me on the compliments he gets from others. I hit a home run with this gift.
review.name: Great Gift Idea for Outdoor worker

review.reviewBody: As work pants in anything below 85˚ these are unbeatable.  As a stone mason, I've destroyed a lot of pants.  Expensive, yes.  But comfortable, the vents work well, the durability is extreme (only Kuhl pant I would say that of).  I've had 3 pairs for three years (ragged by now but hanging on);  southeastern summer months they're too hot to live in;  great the rest of the time.
review.name: tough

review.reviewBody:
I have Vidda Pros, and based on my initial impressions I just won't wear these. I'm returning them; they're not bad per se, but in comparison to other similar pants they just don't hit the mark.

- the second layer knee padding is heavy (pro for me), but it rises very high (nearly crotch level, con), and only goes an inch or two below the knee (con; the most wear is always at or below knee for me).
- the second layer is quite stiff (con for me), other pants have done the second layer quite comfortably.
- the ankle snaps are too close to the elastic band, meaning it doesn't cinch very tightly. If you do cinch it tightly, you'll likely have a bunch of the loose band flapping around. The ankle snaps are done better by competitors.
- the pockets and vents are very nice though, lest it sound like I'm trashing these pants altogether. 

Overall, for me, these just weren't as awesome as very similar function pants I have and that means I won't wear them.
review.name: A fine pant? Yes. Awesome? No.

review.reviewBody:
First and foremost, 
Backcountry is an awesome store, cool people, cool items, cool prices....
Above the law pants are simply the best work pants I've ever owned. Real rugged look, perfect fit, totally comfortable...
It's true what they say, you get what you pay for.  Do yourself a favor and get yourself a pair. Kuhl has quality stuff....
review.name: Real Man Pants
comment:
Decent pants, but nowhere near as durable as claimed or expected. The vents on the upper leg are great. I unfortunately found the same poor customer service attitude and even a lack of product familiarity with one lady I spoke to. 
I ordered a pair of pants direct from them a few hours before placing an order with REI. A week after receiving my REI order I?m still waiting on KUHL. 
Kuhl should do better

name: Above The Law Pant - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Garden Island Jumpsuit - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really want to love this. However whoever designed the side zipper had a good idea but the zipper pull is too small. It’s hard to grasp. I bought a zipper clasp to attach to make it easier. I bought it for my vacation this summer to Sweden but I’m worried about how much work it will be to unzip. I wear a 6-8 and the small was good.
review.name: Comfortable (when wearing)

review.reviewBody:
I live in this jumpsuit for 3 seasons. It's the best! Want to feel like you're wearing jammies? Done! Want to go on a hike, get sweaty, and dry fast? Done! Want to look cute and stylish out to dinner and drinks? Done!

I own many other jumpsuits, but this one is quite the chameleon and can serve almost any occasion (I have it in black, which is a sort of faded black/charcoal). I wish they could make it in a heavier fabric so I could have one in Seattle winters (though the light, flowy fabric is what makes it great and drape beautifully).!

For sizing - the small worked for me. I'm 35-29-40, 5'6", ~135lbs and a 32DD. I have average torso and leg length (neither long legs, nor long torso)... I could imagine that for a very long torso, this might be too short. Drapey things without a defined waist are usually very unflattering on me because my large boobs just hold the fabric out and make me look like a tent, but somehow this jumpsuit doesn't do that. Feels like magic!
review.name: BEST jumpsuit ever

review.reviewBody: The idea of this jumper is cute but the cut is way off. I ordered a medium and it was super snug in the bust. I am somewhat long waisted so the seam was up closer to my bust which caused the garment to hang funny. I bought both colors for an upcoming trip-and the light color was extremely thin and almost see through. I thought about exchanging for the large which likely would have fixed the tight bust issue but not the other problems likely making it even baggier from the seam down. This jumper may work for some, but definitely was wrong for me. I rated it down for the thin material and for the high price, I would have expected better quality from Patagonia.
review.name: Looks better on the computer screen

review.reviewBody: The idea of this jumper is really cute. Great material, super comfortable. I?m 5?1? and 120lbs and the XS hung off me. I returned it. Super bummed though! I would say the XS felt like a medium/ large. So I would definitely size down if you?re able!
review.name: Maybe just not for me?

review.reviewBody: For reference, I am 5?9? 120 pounds and 32 AA and I wear this in an XS. I am size 2 on top and 4 on bottoms (small) and always between xs and small in Patagonia dresses and jumpsuits depending on the style - I always have to try on both sizes. I was shocked this fit so well because I have a long torso but the jumpsuit runs large for my body type. I first bought the dusty blue (plume Gray) and then also ended up finding the charcoal color at another retailer. I have 2/3 colors so I can definitely say I love it! This will be a patagonia item I keep an eye out on in the future to see what other colors they release. They?re very breezy and feel great in the heat. They?re also really soft (thanks to the hemp). I know I?ll be living in these all summer! It?s perfect with an oversized denim jacket on top!
review.name: throw on & go breezy jumpsuit for summer

review.reviewBody: Material and color were great, but the jumpsuit was not flattering on me.  The chest was snug with the side zipper, but the waist was loose.  On the plus side, the torso length was not too short!  Would be a nice addition if you're looking for a very flowy relaxed look. The stock photos are a good representation of actual fit. Ordered size small, 34C, 135 lb, 5' 7". Normally size 4 waist.
review.name: Not flattering

review.reviewBody: A plus of this item: the hemp blend fabric is really soft, and would be excellent for summer. The weakness: sizing. I'm 5'4", and tend to be a true M in most Patagonia bottoms, but I sized down to a S per my past experience with jumpsuits. It was quite loose all over, in a sloppy way, and the crotch hung way too low for me (though I'm a little short-waisted). It's probably best for someone a little taller, so that it hangs the way it should.
review.name: Sizing wasn't right

review.reviewBody: These pants fit well, are warm and comfortable for Northern CA. Unfortunately, the synthetic feathers shed all over my bamboo long johns and socks. I would only order again if the fill was changed.
review.name: Warm & Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I LOVE the fact that they are long, so many people complained but they must be short.  I'm only 5'6, 127 pounds, got a small, and they actually fully cover my ankles which is nice, I hate cold ankles, especially on a pant that is supposed to keep you warm! They are high waisted, which I guess is what you want to keep warm, they are puffy pants, not fashion pants, they are warm which is what you want.  The only thing I don't like is they are kind of loud and crinkly, but not a deal breaker.  Will be good for sitting around the cold tea houses in Nepal while trekking to base camp!
review.name: Great for what they are

review.reviewBody: I got these quilted joggers just in time for winter fun in Maine. They are perfect for those messy, snowy days when you need to be ready for anything. Shoveling, slogging, sledding, building a snow man. Bring it on! I'm wearing my snow pants. They are light, waterproof, and super warm. I am so happy with this purchase!
review.name: Snow Pants for Grownups

review.reviewBody: Super surprised in the quality of these pants, they fit and feel like wearing a puffy trash bag. The eggshell color was sort of translucent so you can see the insulation inside the pants. Overall quality is cheep and the fit was very unique in the most unflattering way.
review.name: Trash Bag Pants

review.reviewBody: Way too long and bulky.
review.name: too long

review.reviewBody: I definitely don't look as good as the model wearing them but they get the job done.  They keep your legs warm and dry when its freezing rain/snowing outside.
review.name: warm but not fashionable..

review.reviewBody: They work well for being wind and water proof! But i do wish the inside was lined with something softer than the windpant material like the outside. You almost have to have leggings on underneath but i do like them and the look! Fit true to size
review.name: They do the job

review.reviewBody:
I read that these pants were long and wasn't worried, I'm 5'8 and figured this would work for me. However, they are definitely still long! I have to cuff them and then some. The material itself wasn't my favorite. The outside is loud and crunchy/crinkly. They definitely feel cheap. Which was unfortunate as I was hoping these could be a cute pair for the après look. 
This wouldn't have been a deciding factor to keep or return but coupled with the length... it was a tough call.
review.name: Long and loud!

review.reviewBody: I got these for chilly mornings/nights that need snow shoveling and dog walks and they are killing it! I've worn them almost every morning and end up sweating after shoveling cause my legs are so warm! If you want to stay even warmer I imagine adding a base layer under will do the trick!
review.name: Puffy pants!

review.reviewBody: I bought a medium.  I’m 5”5’, 150lbs.  They are big enough that I can wear a base layer.  If inbetween sizes, I would size down.  I agree with another poster and they don’t breathe well, so I wouldn’t use them if you are going to get sweaty. I’m using them when I sit outside at my kid’s cold soccer and baseball games and they keep my nice and warm. I think they’re pretty cute too! I get lots of compliments and questions about where I got them when I wear them.
review.name: Warm

name: Puffer Jogger - Women's

review.reviewBody: These were the stiffer hiking boots I've been looking for
review.name: Nice boots!

review.reviewBody: Fantastic boot. Exactly what I needed for some time in the whites.
review.name: Great winter trekking boot.

review.reviewBody: Extremely heavy duty. A little on the heavier side compared to my mountain pros. But overall a quality, made to last boot by Salewa.  The quality is evident throughout.
review.name: “Rapa -CHE”

review.reviewBody: We did overnight on Mt Whitney and I wore these right out of the box. No hot spots and worked with crampons perfectly for the chute because the switchbacks were still snow covered. This is my third pair of Salewas. The first being the Mtn trainer gtx and the second the wildfire 2. Great shoes/boots that stand up to the elements. They do have an approach style toe so it’s a little narrower up front. I have wide feet and it doesn’t bother me that much.
review.name: Excellent Boots

review.reviewBody: I actually use these boots for work. I work in construction in the Northwest, and spend alot of time working on steep roofs, ladders, and uneven terrain. I also have weak ankles due to a previous injury. These boots cover all of that! The rubber compound is great for the roofs with excellent grip, the ankle support is amazing, and they are great on ladders too. They are both dry and durable. I wear them every day.
review.name: A great, agile pair of boots!

review.reviewBody: Hii...I'm Ravi from Northan India (western Himalaya).I run my an adventure company. I have a great liking for this shoes and have been using it since 8 months. One of the best boot I have ever wore. Very comfortable and light. My wear and tear of shoes is great so if this shoe is doing wel so far that means it is a good shoes. Although on slippery surface the shoes has no grip, other wise it has a great grip on rough and scree terrain.
review.name: Very robust design..

review.reviewBody: Get have kept my feet warm and dry under extreme conditions when paired with OR gaiters. Used during active winter conditions.

I usally always purchase Altberg boots hand made in Yorkshire England and are the best boots in the world lasting 7-years of heavy mountain use.  However, I wanted to try something different this time and Bought the Rapace. first use I got a blister on my right inner small toe.  Although the rear ankle support is incredible,  The heel brake is a life saver climbing on mountain loose steep scree.  The Rapace is not an agile or has much dexterity making walking like Frankenstein monster the Rapace seem clumsy whilst hiking in the mountains.  The positive aspects of this boot is the aggressive sole amazing on slippery wet mud grass good on loose scree.  Although,  dangerous on moss covers rocks and frost or light dusting of snow  and can easily slipping over if you are not careful. The features are amazing withe these boots.  Although,  I would (never) have another or purchase These boots again.  I don't think this boots will last  very long probably 2-years max. These are (not) climbing boots and (not) via ferrata to clumsy and no agility.
review.name: Boots okay,  but (not) for the via ferrata  and are very clumsy boots.

review.reviewBody:
This is my 3rd pair of Salewa boots over 10-12 years, and the best of all. I primarily buy them for alpine elk hunting in the high country of Colorado.  I fell in love with the Mt Trainers in 2015, and wore them out. 

 I liked/tolerated the Mt Trooper for 5 years, but couldn’t handle the narrow fit for using several days in a row. 

The Rapace might be the best boot I’ve experienced,  and love the performance straight out of the gate. Solid boots that have excellent support and soles, ample toebox with feeling clownish (enough room to put a toe warmer on top of my socks and still pack 8 mile days), and super lightweight.   Gore Tex liner performed through snow and stream crossings. 

2 notes:  the nubuck leather does not appear to have a factory waterproof treatment. I learned this the hard way, and the wet leather became pretty cold - though my feet stayed dry (thankfully!). You will want to Nikwax them asap. 
Secondly- and this is no diss on Salewa - but what is the deal with cheap stock insoles?  They are worthless. I literally had to toss the ones provided and installed better footbeds. If you’re going to put these boots (and your feet) through the paces, you will regret using what comes installed to protect your feet and keep you comfortable. If this were not true, there would not be a dozen aftermarket insole brands in our shops all of a sudden. I like the footbeds from Scarpa and Remind Insoles. 
To all the footwear brand designers who may never read this review: I would rather receive a packet of Nikwax than some token cheap piece of foam that resembles a slice of cheese.  This is literally where the foot engages with your product, and should be taken more seriously.
review.name: Outstanding boots!

review.reviewBody: The boots are purpose-built...  stiff mountaineering boots for rugged terrain. Used for mountain bear hunting and was very pleased. No complaints or cons yet.

name: Rapace GTX Boot - Men's
